subject: Critical Thinking
title: Heuristics: Mental Shortcuts with a Price
description: A 60-second lesson on Heuristics: Mental Shortcuts with a Price.

hook.text: A heuristic is a rule of thumb: 'If it looks like a duck and quacks like a duck...' Usually right. Sometimes lethal.

buildup.text: Heuristics let us decide fast with limited information. Without them, ordering lunch would take an hour.

discovery.text: Kahneman identified three key heuristics: availability, representativeness, and anchoring. Each creates specific biases.

twist.text: The same shortcut that saves you time at the grocery store can lose you millions in the stock market.

climax.text: Heuristics aren't errors â€” they're trade-offs between speed and accuracy. The key is knowing when accuracy matters.
